headline: Why Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford drove into Carrington amid transfer decision
body: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford drove into Carrington on Thursday to train on his own again.
Rashford arrived at Carrington at 4.47pm, eight minutes after Ruben Amorim had departed.
United sources have denied Rashford was attending Carrington to discuss his future and said the 27-year-old has been training in the afternoons on an individual basis this week.
Rashford arrived through the back gate entrance at Carrington, and Amorim used the front gate.
The relationship between Amorim and Rashford became frosty in mid-December when the academy graduate was dropped from the squad for the Manchester derby at the Etihad.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.

Rashford subsequently signed for Aston Villa on loan in the January transfer window. The Midlands club had the option to sign Rashford permanently for £40million, but decided against triggering that clause.
The academy graduate is now looking for a new club this summer. Rashford is also without a squad shirt number after United decided to give the No.10 shirt to new signing Matheus Cunha.
Rashford last played for United against Viktoria Plzen in the Europa League on December 12.

headline: Ruben Amorim has the green light to unleash Manchester United's new first-choice defence
body: Pre-season preparations are well under way at Carrington.

Some members of Manchester United's first-team squad started to return to the club's training base on Monday before those who were on international duty at the end of last season reported back on Thursday.
Accounting for all the images and training ground footage shared by United throughout the week, 31 players have been spotted participating in training at various stages.

After doing fitness and conditioning testing in the gym, head coach Ruben Amorim is now overseeing matters out on the grass. United's opening friendly is against Leeds United in Stockholm on July 19 and he will be keen to see his side hit the ground running.

Pre-season is the ideal time for head coaches to get their ideas across, implement their plans and edge closer towards working out a first-choice starting XI ahead of the competitive action beginning in August.

With just two new signings through the door so far, Amorim, unless things change quickly between now and a-week-on-Saturday, will not be deploying a team too dissimilar to the one that ended last season in Sweden.

Matheus Cunha is set to become a guaranteed starter at Old Trafford, occupying the left-sided No.10 spot, while it remains to be seen how big a role left-back Diego Leon could play in his first season at the club.

United remain hungry to strengthen their attack this summer, prioritising the signings of Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo and out-and-out centre-forward. They are also keen to sign a midfielder and a goalkeeper.

One area that is not in desperate need of modification, though, is the centre-back department. Despite saying farewell to Jonny Evans and Victor Lindelof at the end of last month, United are still well-stocked at the back.

As things currently stand, United's senior centre-back options consist of Matthijs de Ligt, Harry Maguire, Lisandro Martinez, Leny Yoro and Ayden Heaven. Youngsters Tyler Fredricson, Godwill Kukonki and Reece Munro are also pushing to enter the first-team conversation on a regular basis.

Furthermore, Noussair Mazraoui and Luke Shaw, who are both full-backs by trade, have also shown they are capable of operating at centre-back in Amorim's 3-4-2-1 system. They are both highly versatile and are good options to have.

However, based on how the opening week of pre-season has unfolded, Amorim might have already settled on his preferred back-three ahead of the upcoming clash with Leeds. Neither Martinez, who is still recovering from a long-term anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury, or Maguire have been spotted at Carrington in images released by the club.

On the flip side, De Ligt, Yoro and Heaven have all been present. The trio have joined United within the last 12 months and have a very realistic chance of trying to establish themselves as the members of Amorim's first-choice defence this pre-season.

Heaven has put himself in the conversation to become a regular starter at Old Trafford much quicker than anyone could have anticipated after his arrival from Arsenal at the beginning of February. He had made just one senior appearance for the Gunners, meaning it was surprising United immediately considered him as a first-team player.

However, his performances quickly backed up their thinking. He has not put a foot wrong since arriving at Old Trafford, offering an excellent reading of the game, tremendous ability on the ball and so much more. Additionally, he is also left-footed.

With Martinez still sidelined, the left-sided centre-back spot is Heaven's to lose this summer. However, Yoro produced some excellent performances on the left towards the end of last term and he could also creep into Amorim's thinking.

When United transitioned to a back-three last November, Yoro was immediately tipped to become Amorim's first-choice right-sided centre-back. That situation could still transpire amid Heaven's suitability on the left.

De Ligt is capable of playing on either the right or in the centre of the defence, meaning he is equally comfortable in two roles. But with Maguire yet to have been spotted in training, the Dutchman could find himself starting pre-season in the centre of the defence, flanked by Yoro and Heaven either side of him.
Yoro and Heaven were signed by United to become mainstays in the defence for years to come and there is a very good chance they could nail down their places over the coming weeks.

headline: Manchester United confirm new Chido Obi shirt number ahead of 2025/26 season
body: Manchester United have confirmed young striker Chido Obi has been assigned the No.32 shirt ahead of the 2025/26 campaign.

Following his arrival from Arsenal last year, the Danish youth international developed at a rapid rate of knots, making such a telling impression at youth level that he was awarded by his senior debut by Ruben Amorim in February.
The 17-year-old made his United bow as a late substitute in a 1-0 defeat to Tottenham Hotspur at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in the Premier League.
That was his first of eight first-team appearances before the end of the season.
He notched his first goals in United colours in the post-season tour, scoring a second half brace in the 3-1 win over Hong Kong.
He is expected to go on the pre-season tour of the United States later this month.

Ahead of United's opening pre-season friendly against Leeds United in Stockholm next weekend, they have confirmed Obi has been given a new shirt number ahead of the new campaign, being given No.32. He wore the No.56 shirt last season.

Obi, who represented Denmark's Under-20s at the Maurice Revello Tournament last month, will have grand ambitions of taking his development to the next level in 2025/26. He becomes the first United player to have donned the No.32 shirt since Sam Johnstone in 2016/17.

Meanwhile, young defender Tyler Fredricson has also been given a new shirt number ahead of the upcoming campaign, swapping No.55 for No.33. The centre-back made his United debut on Easter Sunday, starting the 1-0 defeat to Wolves at Old Trafford, before starting the 4-3 defeat at Brentford a couple of weeks later.
Diogo Dalot was also assigned a new shirt number earlier this week, being given the No.2 shirt, while Matheus Cunha has also been installed as the club's new No.10.

headline: New signings, youngsters - every Man United player involved in first-team training this week
body: Manchester United welcomed their international contingent back to Carrington on Thursday, meaning head coach Ruben Amorim is now working with almost every member of his squad.

United will kick off their pre-season campaign against Leeds United in Stockholm in just over a week's time and Amorim is expected to take a plethora of players with him for their curtain-raising fixture.

Pre-season is an ideal time for every head coach to tinker with his squad and hand out opportunities to as many members of it ahead of the competitive action starting in August. United will play a total of five friendlies this summer.
Based on training ground footage and images shared by United this week, a total of 31 players have been accounted for to have been involved in first-team training this week.
New signings Matheus Cunha and Diego Leon were among 15 first-team players to report back to the club's training ground for the start of pre-season on Monday.

Other figures present at the start of the week included Andre Onana, Matthijs de Ligt, Mason Mount, Joshua Zirkzee and Amad. The likes of Diogo Dalot, Manuel Ugarte, Bruno Fernandes, Rasmus Hojlund and Casemiro reported back on Thursday after being granted a few extra days off after being on international duty at the end of last season.
Images issued by United throughout the week have confirmed that several youngsters have trained alongside the club's senior stars such as Jaydan Kamason, Reece Munro, and Shea Lacey.

The opening week of pre-season has featured work both in the gym and out on the grass, meaning United's players have been put through their paces in every possible way, with club staff refusing to leave any stone unturned.

Alongside the aforementioned quintet, there has also been no sighting of centre-backs Harry Maguire or Lisandro Martinez this week. The latter is still recovering from a long-term ACL injury, but Maguire has not been spotted in any of the footage or images shared by the club and it remains unclear why that has been the case.
Goalkeepers: Andre Onana, Altay Bayindir, Tom Heaton, Dermot Mee, Radek Vitek & Elyh Harrison.
Defenders: Diogo Dalot, Noussair Mazraoui, Matthijs de Ligt, Leny Yoro, Ayden Heaven, Tyler Fredricson, Reece Munro, Patrick Dorgu, Luke Shaw, Diego Leon, Harry Amass & Jaydan Kamason.
Midfielders: Casemiro, Manuel Ugarte, Kobbie Mainoo, Toby Collyer, Mason Mount, Bruno Fernandes, Shea Lacey.
Attackers: Amad, Matheus Cunha, Joshua Zirkzee, Rasmus Hojlund, Chido Obi, Bendito Mantato.

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Bryan Mbeumo latest, Alvaro Carreras clause, Dusan Vlahovic talks
body: Hello and welcome to our live blog on the very latest Manchester United transfer news on Friday, July 11.
Ruben Amorim's men are back in pre-season training at Carrington as preparations for the 2025/26 get underway. However, there remains a big focus on United's transfer business.

Matheus Cunha has already arrived from Wolves for £62.5million but the Reds have struggled to get a deal over the line for Bryan Mbeumo. Two bids have been turned down by Brentford and a third bid has been tipped.

Alongside the 25-year-old, United are also exploring the possibility of signing a new striker. A move for Victor Osimhen and Viktor Gyokeres has been mentioned for the majority of the summer but Amorim is facing being short on options.

Free agents Jamie Vardy, Callum Wilson and Dominic Calvert-Lewin have all reportedly been offered to United. A move for either is expected to only be sanctioned closer to the end of the window, if other top targets aren't signed.
Keep across all the latest United transfer news and analysis in our live blog updates below...
Manchester United's search for a striker goes on with their options continuing to dwindle this summer.

Liam Delap was heavily linked towards the end of 2024/25, but the Reds' failure to qualify for the Champions League appears to have cost them there after he opted to join Chelsea. Viktor Gyokeres was another option with his links to United boss Ruben Amorim from their time at Sporting together, making many feel it was a perfect match.
And yet another Premier League rival in Arsenal appears set to win that particular race. The Reds must now look at other options once they conclude a deal for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo.
Read the full story here
Manchester United are still chasing a deal for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo. The Reds are back in training this week, having secured two new signings.

United activated the £62.5 million release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract earlier this month, bringing the Wolves forward to Old Trafford on a five-year deal with an option for an extra year. Additionally, Paraguayan left-back Diego Leon has joined the club.
Read more here
Manchester United have been relatively quiet in the transfer market so far this summer.
The signing of Matheus Cunha is the only piece of business completed by United so far, but there are several players who are continuing to be linked with moves to Old Trafford.
It's now your chance to have your say on how you think United's summer transfer window has panned out so far.
Viktor Gyokeres is one of the most sought-after strikers in Europe this summer, and Manchester United are now being linked with his signature.
Reports have speculated that Arsenal are the most likely destination for Gyokeres should he leave Sporting Lisbon this summer.
Now a fresh update has emerged providing details on United's chances of signing Gyokeres.
MORE HERE.
Manchester United goalkeeper Tom Heaton as opened up on the responibilities he will be taking on at Old Trafford after signing a new contract.
"My priority is playing and working hard to try and get in the team," Heaton told United's club website.

"That's always the priority, but as a senior player, and someone who signed at 11, left aged 24 and came back at 35, the values of this football club are ingrained inside me and I want to make sure that new players who come into the building have an understanding of what the club means to the fans, what the traditions are, what the values are, as well as accepting that it also requires a period to evolve.
"I see that as part of my role, being supportive. Even with the new players, Matheus [Cunha] and Diego [Leon] coming through the door, offering that support if they need anything."
There's not long to wait before United's pre-season preparations officially get underway.
United will travel to Sweden to face Leeds United at the Strawberry Arena on July 19 in their first pre-season fixture of the summer.

After that, United will go to the United States for friendly matches against West Ham, Bournemouth and Everton before returning to Old Trafford for their final pre-season fixture against Fiorentina on August 9.
Marcus Rashford has provided an update after arriving at Manchester United's training ground ahead of the start of pre-season.

Rashford continuing to be linked with a move away from Old Trafford. The 27-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan at Aston Villa, which included a £40million option to buy, which was not activated.

As a result, Rashford will now return to United this summer and looks set to depart on a permanent deal as he searches for a new club. Amid the speculation about his future, the England international posted a series of videos on his social media platforms.
MORE HERE.
Chido Obi has been given a new squad number at Manchester United.
The club have confirmed that the striker will wear the No.32 shirt next season, a reward after enjoying his breakthrough campaign with the first-team last term.
Obi made eight appearances for United last season and is expected to make the trip to the United States for pre-season.
MORE HERE.
Manchester United are holding up Alvaro Carreras' move to Real Madrid, according to reports. The Spaniard failed to make a first-team appearance during his four years at Old Trafford.

He spent time out on loan at Preston, Granada and Benfica before making the £7million permanent switch to the Portuguese side last summer. But after just 12 months in the Primeira Liga, Carreras could be set to move to Real in a blockbuster deal worth around £43m.
However, United are holding up the deal as they have a buyback clause. Ruben Amorim's side have to confirm their intention not to trigger that clause.

Manchester United could be offered the chance to reignite their interest in Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite NEXT summer after the Daily Mail reported that he has a £70million release clause that can be triggered from the end of the 2025/26 season.

United had two offers rejected for Branthwaite last summer and he ended up signing a new five-year contract at Everton following another solid campaign. But it's claimed that he has an exit clause of £70m should he want to leave the Toffees next summer.
Real Madrid have rejected a £78million bid from Manchester United for Aurelien Tchouameni, according to Spanish journalist Eduardo Inda.
United have been tracking Tchouameni's progress and are keen to strengthen their midfield following the departure of Christian Eriksen. The Frenchman would be a strong addition.
Barcelona are prepared to go 'all-in' to sign Marcus Rashford from Manchester United this summer, as per Sky Germany.

Journalist Florian Plettenberg said in a post on X, formerly known as Twitter, on Friday morning: "As revealed on 6 July, the priority for FC Barcelona is Marcus #Rashford. Barca want to try again for Rashford and are prepared to go all-in."
Plettenberg added: "Rashford is now the clear number one target. Talks are ongoing. Green light from Hansi Flick was already given days ago. The 27-year-old winger is set to leave Manchester United."

Rashford scored four times and provided six assists in 17 appearances during a loan spell at Aston Villa last season. He is one of five United players that have informed the club of his desire to explore different opportunities this summer.
Manchester United have reached a 'basic agreement' with Juventus regarding the transfer of Jadon Sancho, according to La Stampa.
Sancho, 25, has given the greenlight to make the move to Turin, with United agreeing to sell him in a deal worth around £17.2million.
The England international, who spent last season on loan at Chelsea, is expected to sign a long-term contract and earn £5.1m per year at Juventus.
Manchester United are open to allowing Andre Onana to leave the club for as a little as £30million this summer, according to the Daily Mail.
Monaco enquired about the possibility of signing the Cameroon international and £30m was the figure that United put forward, as they look to cash in on the goalkeeper.
If the Reds decided to sell for that price, it would represent a significant financial hit on the £47m they paid Inter Milan to sign Onana two years ago.
Manchester United have enquired about a potential move for Southampton star Tyler Dibling, according to The Sun. The 19-year-old impressed during his breakthrough Premier League season in 2024/25.
However, Saints value the teenager at £47million. As well as United, Tottenham, Nottingham Forest and West Ham are keen on signing the wide forward.
Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford drove into Carrington on Thursday to train on his own again. Rashford, 27, arrived at Carrington at 4.47pm, eight minutes after Ruben Amorim had departed.
United sources have denied Rashford was attending Carrington to discuss his future and said the 27-year-old has been training in the afternoons on an individual basis this week.
Rashford arrived through the back gate entrance at Carrington, and Amorim used the front gate.
Read the full story here.
Manchester United are considering a summer swoop for Dominic Calvert-Lewin, who is available as a free agent after leaving Everton at the end of last month, according to CaughtOffside.
Calvert-Lewin, 28, scored just three goals in 26 Premier League appearances last season and it's claimed he is a 'serious' target for United, but wages could prove to be an issue.
Calvert-Lewin is expected to ask for around £100,000 per week - a demand that could come as too expensive for the Reds.
Atalanta goalkeeper Marco Carnesecchi is Manchester United's top target for that position, according to reports in Italy.
He made 44 appearances in all competitions last season and kept 18 clean sheets - 13 in Serie A and five in the Champions League.
However, any deal for Carnesecchi may be dependent on Andre Onana's future and a move for the Cameroonian.
According to 90min.com, Juventus are keen to offload Dusan Vlahovic this summer and Manchester United are showing interest.
It's added that United may have the edge after opening talks over a swap deal involving out-of-favour winger Jadon Sancho.
Vlahovic, 25, scored 17 goals in 44 appearances during the 2024/25 season and netted against Manchester City at the Club World Cup.
Hello and welcome to our live Manchester United transfer news blog on this fine Friday morning.
Stay tuned for the latest throughout the day from Old Trafford...
Thank you for joining us on the United transfer blog tonight.
We will be back again bright and early tomorrow bringing you more updates from Old Trafford.
Until then, take care of yourselves and good night.
After a cryptic post on social media of himself on a private jet with the simple caption: "Coming," it appears Garnacho is free to train with the Reds' first-team.
Despite being told by Amorim that he is free to find a new club this summer, ESPN understands that the Argentine will not be blocked from training with his teammates when he returns to Carrington.

Garnacho is one of five players who informed United that he wished to sign for another club in the summer transfer window. He was therefore given an extended break to try and facilitate a deal elsewhere.
It is hard to argue against what Ferdinand is saying about Mbeumo.
United have got themselves too deep into this saga not to sign the Cameroonian now.
Not signing Mbeumo would be a huge come down for the Reds and risks being a very bad start to the summer transfer window.
Tomorrow, there will be 37 days remaining until the start of the Premier League season and United have only made one major signing...
Speaking on his podcast, Rio Ferdinand has insisted that United have little choice but to meet Brentford's valuation of Bryan Mbeumo this summer.

United need to find a way of meeting Brentford's valuation. The proposal doesn't seem to be enough for Brentford, but Manchester United need to get this done. It's been in the news for far too long, to get to a situation to get to the end of the window and it doesn't happen, I think that will be an egg-on-the-face situation for Man United unless they go and get someone else. Who have they got waiting in the wings as an alternative? We haven't heard any names that are close.
Despite these reports of a delay in negotiations between Napoli and Galatasaray for Osimhen, it seems this ship has sailed for United.
The Reds are still focused on Mbeumo and that could be to their detriment.
Osimhen will be given a hero's welcome back to Istanbul should he complete this move and you have to think that United could have missed a trick.
According to Gianluca Di Marzio, Napoli have paused transfer talks with Galatasaray for Victor Osimhen.
It is understood that there has been a delay to the move due to Gala's current inability to provide 'bank guarantees'.
As such, the talks have been halted until these guarantees have been met.
United confirmed this afternoon that young defender Sonny Aljofree has left the club to join Notts County on loan.
The 20-year-old made 25 appearances for Accrington Stanley last season in League Two and he returns to that level with the Nottinghamshire club.
In 2022, Aljofree starred alongside Garnacho and Mainoo as the young Reds won the Youth Cup.
According to Sport, Antony has a burning desire to sign for Real Betis in the summer transfer window.
It is understood that there is currently no agreement in place with the Seville club at this stage.
MEN Sport understands that Antony is one of five players who has told the club he wants to leave this summer.
Real Betis are reportedly confident enough that Antony wants to sign for them that they are willing to drag the saga into the final stages of the window to force United's hand.
According to Cameroon's assistant Ashu Cyprian Besong, Mbeumo is growing increasingly frustrated by the lack of movement in the switch to United.
Speaking to Telecom Asia, Besong said:

Yes, obviously he’s very frustrated with how long it’s taken. But he’s a professional and anticipates these things. I spoke to him about a week ago and he is very calm with everything that is going on. But of course, he’s already told them he wants to go to United. He just wanted the two clubs to find an agreement, as he’s very grateful for the opportunity that he’s been given by Brentford in his career.
It is being reported this evening that Nottingham Forest's Morgan Gibbs-White is set for a medical at Tottenham after Spurs activated his release clause.

With that, David Ornstein reports that Forest have renewed their interest in Brentford's Yoane Wissa and with money coming in for both Gibbs-White and Elanga, the east Midlands club have money to spend.
Yesterday we brought you news that the Bees are only willing to allow one of Wissa or Mbeumo to leave this summer.
At the moment, there has yet to be a breakthrough in negotiations with Brentford for Mbeumo so Forest's interest in Wissa could be a concern.

headline: Marcus Rashford sparks Barcelona transfer theory after dream move 'green light'
body: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford has continued to drop hints of his keenness to join Barcelona this summer.

Rashford, 27, is expected to leave United after returning from his loan spell at Aston Villa. The academy graduate is not in Ruben Amorim's plans for the 2025/26 season but a move hasn't materialised yet.

It's been heavily reported that the forward's dream move is to join Barcelona and is willing to take a pay cut to seal a move to the La Liga champions. A possibility of a transfer agreement being reached had seemed in doubt when Barca pushed for Nico Williams but the Spain international instead signed a new contract at Athletic Bilbao.

A move for Luiz Diaz has also been tipped for Barcelona but Liverpool remain adamant at keeping the Colombian. Reports this week have suggested that the Spanish giants are now ready to pursue Rashford with Hansi Flick giving the green light.
United are keen to sell Rashford rather than a loan with a £40million valuation demanded. However, it's understood that Barcelona prefer a loan deal.

After returning to Carrington to train on an individual basis this week, Rashford has sparked excitement among the Barcelona fanbase by liking Lamine Yamal's Instagram post. The Spanish sensation posted 17 images of him enjoying his summer break, writing: "enjoy what you dream of".

Rashford was one of the 1.5million+ to like the Instagram post alongside Patrick Dorgu and Ethan Wheatley. It comes after the United star outlined his desire to play alongside Yamal during an interview last month.
When asked about the prospect of playing with Yamal in an interview with Spanish influencer Javi Ruiz, Rashford said: "Yes, for sure, Everyone wants to play with the best. Hopefully... we'll see."
On Yamal, who has excelled over the last 12 months, Rashford added: "[It is] difficult to put into words what he is doing. He is not supposed to be doing that at 16-17 [years of age].
"We have not seen that before. It is a skill to be able to play at that age with that mentality."

headline: Manchester United only need £52m to solve Ruben Amorim transfer issue no-one is talking about
body: Manchester United's summer transfer window remains the dominant talking point despite the new Premier League season being on the horizon.

United have made one new addition to their squad with the arrival of Matheus Cunha in a £62.5million deal from Wolves. Cunha has been given the No.10 shirt at United and will be a valuable option in the forward line for next term.

Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo continues to be a target for United this summer, with two bids already being rejected. United are also interested in bringing in a new centre forward this summer, with a host of names already being mentioned as potential targets.

There have been reports linking possible new signings for almost every area of the pitch for United this summer. Whether it be at goalkeeper, midfield or the forward line, there continues to be rumours of new additions being made to the squad at Ruben Amorim's disposal.

One area of the team that could arguably be in need of reinforcements is at centre-back. United currently have Leny Yoro, Matthis de Ligt, Harry Maguire, Lisandro Martinez and Ayden Heaven as the senior central defenders at the club.

Martinez will not return from a serious knee injury until later in the year, and the departures of Victor Lindelof and Jonny Evans mean United will currently go into the campaign with three centre-backs at their disposal. Luke Shaw has shown his ability to play in the middle of the defence, especially on the left side of a back-three deployed by Amorim.

But, when looking at the numbers available to start the campaign, it cannot be denied that United need at least one new signing to be a centre-back this summer. Who that player could be remains to be seen.

One player who could be worth a look at in the transfer market is Goncalo Inacio. The Sporting Lisbon star has been linked with a move to the Premier League in the past, and, unsurprisingly, United, too, given the defender was previously coached by Amorim during his time in Portugal.
Inacio has a release clause in his contract worth €60million (£52million) which has been active since he signed a new contract back in 2023.

The centre-back has now entered the final two years of his deal with Sporting, which runs out in 2027, which could present an opportunity for United if they decide to go into the market for a new defender.

headline: Manchester United are being left behind by their Premier League rivals in the transfer window
body: The summer transfer window was just 14 hours old when Manchester United announced they had reached an agreement with Wolves to sign Matheus Cunha on June 1.
United triggered the Brazilian's £62.5million release clause and his move to Old Trafford was subject to him obtaining a visa and registration. The deal was officially completed 11 days later.

During that brief waiting period, United also tabled an opening offer for Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo after learning he wants to move to Old Trafford this summer. Their opening bid, worth £55m, was swiftly rejected.

United returned with another bid last month, understood to be in excess of £60m, and it appeared as though that would be enough to make the Cameroon international their second summer signing. However, negotiations remain ongoing and supporters are becoming frustrated.

United are treading a fine line between attempting to strengthen the squad and avoid paying over the odds this summer. Mbeumo scored 20 Premier League goals last summer and Brentford are within their rights to hold out for as high a price as possible.

As much as United want Mbeumo and as much as he wants to move to M16, the Reds must remain mindful that the clock is ticking. The start of their pre-season tour is just a fortnight away and the start of the new Premier League season will be here before you know it.

Having first made contact with Brentford just over five weeks ago, United have got themselves involved in an unwanted saga. They wanted to sign Mbeumo in time for the start of pre-season training and that deadline has been and gone.

With little progress being made on other fronts, United's fast start to the window is becoming a distant memory. Ruben Amorim's side finished 15th in the Premier League last season and the Portuguese chief is desperate to add fresh blood to his squad.

What makes matters worse for United and their supporters is what is happening elsewhere. After Liverpool and Manchester City made storming starts to the window, signing the likes of Jeremie Frimpong, Florian Wirtz, Rayan Ait-Nouri and Rayan Cherki, Tottenham Hotspur are now flexing their muscless.

They completed the £55m signing of Mohammed Kudus from West Ham United on Thursday evening and are reportedly closing in on the signing of Nottingham Forest star Morgan Gibbs-White after triggering his £60m release clause.

Arsenal are also greasing their wheels. After adding Christian Norgaard to the signings of Kepa Arrizabalaga and Martin Zubimendi earlier this week, they are now closing in on the signing of Chelsea winger Noni Madueke. Chelsea, too, have been very busy.

Circumstances at every club differ, not least financially, and it is no secret United are having to sell in order to buy this summer. That situation is making the task of bringing new faces in much harder.
Nevertheless, when supporters glance at the business being conducted by the likes of Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, City and Spurs, they are naturally going to become restless and frustrated.

United were dreadful last season, offering very little in the way of positives, meaning they have no choice but to make the most of this summer's window. It is the most important summer they have faced in their modern history.

You cannot dismiss the fact United have spent more than £60m on Cunha, a proven Premier League operator who is tailor-made for Amorim's system. They also deserve plaudits for persevering with their quest to sign Mbeumo, who was the fourth-highest goalscorer in the Premier League last season.

However, as mid-July approaches, supporters can be forgiven for becoming impatient. Other Premier League clubs, many of whom enjoyed a far better season than the Reds did last term, are cracking on with their business at a decent pace.

Spurs' recent movements have been the tipping point for many, forcing some supporters to pick up their phones and express their feelings on social media. The prospect of signing Kudus and Gibbs-White in the same week is one way to make a statement.

It would be fantastic to see Mbeumo start the new season in United colours, and many believe the situation has come too far for that not to happen, but the longer this particular saga goes on, United are at an increased risk of being left behind.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres latest action speaks volumes after huge Man United transfer claim
body: Viktor Gyokeres has reportedly failed to report for pre-season training with Sporting Clube de Portugal, amid ongoing speculation over his future and links to Manchester United.

Arsenal had been engaged in talks with Sporting in the last few weeks but both parties have been unable to agree a fee. The Gunners are said to be preparing an offer worth €65million (£56m) with add-ons amount to €5m (£4m) and €10m (£8m), which would take the overall package to €80m (£69m).

But the Portuguese giants want a guaranteed €70m (£60m) with no add-ons for their prized asset. On Thursday, journalist Ben Jacobs reported that a move to Old Trafford remains a possibility, with the striker’s representatives aware that a deal could still be revived through the Reds.

There is already tension between Gyokeres and the club he helped with two league titles and a domestic cup - including their double last season. A few weeks ago, it was suggested that he would not return for pre-season and would look to force a move away from the Portuguese capital.

He has stayed true to his stance, with Portuguese outlet A Bola reporting that Gyokeres, who was due to report for pre-season on Friday, was absent. He is reportedly expected by Sporting to rejoin the squad by Saturday, ahead of their trip to the Algarve for their summer training camp.

But that now appears unlikely, with reports stating that he is still in Sweden and currently on 'strike.' It's added that only a last-minute breakthrough in negotiations would convince him to return to Portugal.

Sporting, meanwhile, will reportedly wait until Saturday before making a public statement on the situation. They are said to be monitoring whether Gyokeres continues to be absent without justification.

A Bola notes that five consecutive unexcused absences or ten intermittent ones could be sufficient grounds for the player's dismissal. However, Sporting are unlikely to take such action, as it would mean losing their most valuable asset.
He is still said to be expected to receive 'heavy fines' from the club.

headline: Dream Man United summer transfer window - £85m bombshell, Marcus Rashford exit and big gamble
body: Manchester United's summer transfer window has been hard work so far with Matheus Cunha the only major signing to be completed to date.

By this point in the summer, Ruben Amorim would have hoped for more deals to have been ticked off ahead of the first match of pre-season a week on Saturday. Friday, August 11, marks 37 days until that opening fixture against Arsenal at Old Trafford and United will hope by then that their squad looks a lot different.

The big deadline that United will be working towards is Monday, September 1 when the summer transfer window shuts for good. With this in mind, MEN Sport has taken a look at what a dream transfer window would look like between now and Tuesday, September 2, when we are reviewing United's business.

First on the agenda for United will be to complete the deal for Bryan Mbeumo. The Brentford forward may have played out on the wing predominantly last season but he has the capabilities to play more centrally and we are perhaps all tired of the will he, won't he debate.

Ultimately, the 25-year-old would be a good addition for United in the face of no European football this season to tempt other targets to switch to Old Trafford. The Reds would have a strong array of options at No.10 if he were to join and the move would put to bed talk that United wasted a large chunk of the window chasing a player they could not attain.
On Friday, talk intensified surrounding the future of Marcus Rashford. MEN Sport revealed the winger arrived at Carrington this week eight minutes after Amorim left the training facility.

Rashford has been undertaking an individual training regime at United's hub and has not been with his first-team teammates. After being burnt by Nico Williams, Barcelona look to have set their sights on Rashford and a move to Camp Nou would be ideal for all involved.
The United academy graduate appears to be keen on the switch and will work with Barca to make that deal happen quickly. For the Reds, the idea of £40m of pure profit will be music to Ineos' ears.

With Rashford off the books, the plan would be to look at centre-forward options and potentially a move for Hugo Ekitike could be a real statement of intent. United are believed to have enquired about the Eintracht Frankfurt man and discovered they will need to stump up £85m for his signature.

Only sales would make that move possible for United - perhaps beyond Rashford, which we will get to. But, with one of their wantaways off the books, the Reds could feel encouraged to spend big on a player who is perhaps the closest person to Alexander Isak realistically available.
As mentioned briefly, United would need to make another couple of sales to fund such a gargantuan bid for Ekitike. The priorities there would be Alejandro Garnacho and Jadon Sancho.

Both men want to leave Old Trafford and could bring in some good money, particularly Garnacho. Antony would also be a decent player to sell but it feels like United are stuck in the unfortunate position of relying on Real Betis to make a decent bid, making a loan switch perhaps the only logical move.
Amid all the talk of changes to the attack, the big gamble would be to keep Rasmus Hojlund at Old Trafford. He clearly has a desire to remain in Manchester and fight for his place.

If he were to stay, it would represent a vote of confidence from Amorim and perhaps that Hojlund has turned over a new leaf after the disastrous second season. Once again, it would be a big gamble but if Amorim is willing to take it, it would be a dream scenario for the Reds.

headline: Bruno Fernandes shows true Manchester United colours with brilliant Mason Mount message
body: Bruno Fernandes has appeared to praise Mason Mount as Manchester United continue their preparations for the new season.

The United captain returned to pre-season training on Thursday, and among those to return first on Monday was England international Mount, who is preparing for an important season in his United career after a difficult start. He joined the Reds in a £60m deal from Chelsea in 2023 but hasn't set the world alight, with the midfielder struggling with form and injuries.

Following Mount's first day back in pre-season, he posted on Instagram. The 25-year-old included several images of him on the training field and in the gym working hard as he prepares for the 2025/26 campaign.
Fernandes opted to comment on the post and simply used a GIF which showed Beckham celebrating his infamous halfway line goal against Wimbledon at Selhurst Park back in 1996.
The meaning of Fernandes' message is unknown, but it's clear he is praising Mount, and that could help the ex-Derby loanee to get back to his best ahead of the new season.
Mount started just six Premier League matches in 2024/25. He missed a sizeable chunk of the season after suffering two muscle injuries and was never able to get a consistent run in the team.

After Mount returned and scored against Athletic Club de Bilbao in May, Amorim praised the midfielder for coming back after several setbacks. "It's important for every player [to return]," Amorim said at the time. "But when you see that kind of guy working hard every day, eating well, resting, and taking ice bath. He does everything.
"When you have this kind of player, you just want to help them."

headline: Manchester United star Marcus Rashford shares new update after Carrington arrival cleared up
body: Marcus Rashford has provided an update after arriving at Manchester United's training ground ahead of the start of pre-season.

United are currently gearing up for the start of the new Premier League campaign which gets underway on Sunday, August 17 at home to Arsenal. Between now and then, United will take part in five pre-season fixtures that will see them travel to Sweden and then the United States.

Away from the action on the pitch is the summer transfer window, with Rashford continuing to be linked with a move away from Old Trafford. The 27-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan at Aston Villa, which included a £40million option to buy, which was not activated.

As a result, Rashford will now return to United this summer and looks set to depart on a permanent deal as he searches for a new club. Amid the speculation about his future, the England international posted a series of videos on his social media platforms.

On his Instagram story, Rashford posted three videos to his 17.1million followers on Friday morning which showed the United star taking part in several gym exercises as he works on his fitness. Rashford appeared to be working alone with his gym routine, which included some weight and muscle exercises.

The updates from Rashford come after there was speculation about the reason behind his arrival at Carrington on Thursday afternoon. Rashford arrived at United's training ground at 4.47pm, which was eight minutes after head coach Ruben Amorim had left for the day.

December 12 against Viktoria Plzen in the Europa League is the last time that Rashford made an appearance for United. The forward has been heavily linked with a move to Barcelona in recent weeks with the rumours continue to swirl as the transfer window rolls on.

headline: RAILSTON: United announce Old Trafford update and confirm timeline for 100,000 seater
body: Manchester United are still planning to build a new 100,000-seater Old Trafford in around five years.
In March, United unveiled ambitious plans for a state-of-the-art 100,000-seater stadium at an event in London and co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe said the project could be completed by 2030.

Club sources say the project has progressed well in the past few months. The feasibility work on land assembly and financing continues, which will inform the pace at which the project will move, but United are still planning to realise their vision in the initial timeframe.
That update came as the Mayor of Greater Manchester, Andy Burnham, announced a 10-year growth plan for the region.
The Old Trafford Regeneration project is a part of the growth plan and Lord Sebastian Coe has been appointed as the Chair-Designate of the Mayoral Development Corporation (MDC) to oversee it.

Omar Berrada, CEO of United, reacted to the update and said: “This is an exciting decade for the region, and we warmly welcome the inclusion of the Old Trafford Regeneration project at the heart of the Greater Manchester Strategy.

“We are also delighted by the appointment of Lord Coe as Chair-Designate of the Mayoral Development Corporation; the continuity it brings for the wider project will be a huge positive. In addition, Lord Coe’s proven leadership and track record in delivering transformational projects will be invaluable as we work together to turn our collective vision into reality.

“In March, we announced our ambition for a new stadium and since then we have been progressing those plans. Today’s announcement is a significant step forward in our shared vision for the revival of this area of the city that requires investment to thrive again.”
United have conceded they cannot deliver their ambitious vision for Old Trafford alone, which has seen the club work closely with national and local government, as well as Trafford Council.

The club and city region are also said to be aligned with the aim of bringing significant fixtures at the FIFA Women’s World Cup in 2035 to the stadium, including the final, as much of the regeneration of the area will be complete.
Architects Foster + Partners are responsible for designing the new 100,000-seater stadium.

headline: Manchester United have a player who could be like a new signing this season
body: When Manchester United appointed Ruben Amorim as Erik ten Hag's successor last November, few players in the squad stood to benefit more than Manuel Ugarte.

The midfield enforcer, who had joined United from Paris Saint-Germain just over two months earlier, worked with Amorim at Sporting Lisbon, racking up 85 appearances under his stewardship during his time in the Portuguese capital.
Ugarte had arrived at Old Trafford from the Parc des Princes with the task of providing United's midfield with some much-needed defensive nous.

Despite an excellent debut season at United in 2022/23, Casemiro regressed the following season, making the addition of a defensive-minded midfielder a leading priority for the 2024 summer transfer window. United spent several weeks in negotiations with PSG and eventually signed Ugarte on deadline day last August.

After confirming Ugarte's arrival for an initial fee of £42.3million, former United sporting director Dan Ashworth said of the Uruguayan international: "Signing Manuel was another of our primary targets for this summer. He is among the very best ball-winning midfield players in the world and has an excellent record at both club and international level.
"His qualities, experience and passion will be a great complement to our strong group of midfielders."

Evidence of that was on show in the latter stages of Ten Hag's tenure when he appeared reluctant to select the former Sporting midfielder. He played just seven times under the Dutchman prior to his exit on October 28, making just three starts, of which only one of them was in the Premier League.
It meant the appointment of Amorim felt significant in Ugarte's hopes of nailing down his place in the team. Many anticipated he would join forces with Kobbie Mainoo in the engine room.

Despite playing 34 times between Amorim's arrival and the end of the season, Ugarte's omission from the starting line-up for the Europa League final and the Premier League finale against Aston Villa felt telling.
Casemiro got the nod against Tottenham Hotspur in Bilbao, starting in midfield alongside Bruno Fernandes. Ugarte failed to make it off the bench that evening.

Throughout his debut season at Old Trafford, United fans saw the good and the bad of Ugarte. They witnessed how he has the credentials to maintain order in midfield out of possession, helping United keep their shape and win possession back, but they also witnessed flaws in his game when in possession.
Unlike in France and Portugal, Ugarte is not blessed with as much time on the ball in the Premier League. The division is played at a frantic pace and you need eyes in the back of your head.

As a defensive shield and midfield battering ram, Ugarte offers all of the varying qualities you need to fulfil that duty. On the ball, though, he is far from perfect, meaning it is easy to understand why United want to sign a midfielder this summer who can offer a little bit of everything.
However, amid United's desperate need to strengthen their attack, the addition of a midfielder might be put on the back burner.
Fernandes is poised to occupy one of the two No.8 spots and he will need a defensive-minded operator alongside him to ensure United maintain a sense of balance in midfield.

Ugarte is best qualified to offer that defensive nous, but he must raise his game if he is to make one of the two central midfield spots his own. As a result, pre-season will be vitally important for him this summer.

He joined United on August 31 last year, meaning he was thrown in at the deep end. Adjusting to a new club is hard enough, but when you join a club of United's stature, and are tasked with the challenge of fixing the team's biggest weakness, the job becomes even harder.
With a full pre-season under his belt this summer, Ugarte should be all the better for it. If he makes the most of it, there is no reason why he cannot reach his best levels under Amorim again.

headline: RAILSTON: United set to make major change as transfer strategy overhaul explained
body: Manchester United are searching for a head of senior recruitment as part of the club's transfer strategy overhaul.
The new role will involve overseeing the senior scouts and reporting back to Christopher Vivell.

Vivell joined United on a temporary basis last year and was appointed permanently as the director of recruitment in February. He oversees the club's recruitment network and reports to the director of football, Jason Wilcox.
United will also have a regional heads of emerging talent across the main talent pools globally.
Club sources have said the appointments are part of the ongoing restructuring and modernisation of the scouting network at Old Trafford, which has recently been streamlined under Vivell.
United plan to retain significant human scouting and analytical capabilities, particularly focused on emerging talent, with strengthened data support, amid the changes to the network.
Sportsology, a United States-based sports intelligence consultancy, are supporting United on the hires.
The consultancy firm have worked with MLS sides Inter Miami and FC Cincinnati, and NFL franchises such as the San Francisco 49ers, the Philadelphia Eagles and Los Angeles Rams.
United sources have previously said they want Vivell to take ownership of the reduced scouting network after years of poor business in the transfer market.
United's scouting network was once so bloated it was in excess of 100 scouts but dozens have left the club across the two rounds of redundancies over the past 12 months.
Vivell, 38, previously worked at RB Leipzig and Chelsea, where he was the technical director for only six months.

headline: Manchester United star has 37 days to convince Ruben Amorim not to make £60m transfer
body: Arriving at Carrington on Thursday morning, Rasmus Hojlund showed no signs of a Manchester United player feeling the pressure of expectation this summer.

Sporting a Michael Jordan graphic t-shirt, Hojlund will hope that he can embody the Chicago Bulls legend at Old Trafford this season. However, time is of the essence to prove that to his own Phil Jackson - Ruben Amorim.
Last season was one that is best forgotten from Hojlund's perspective. While his performances in the Europa League were manageable, it was the Premier League that proved to be his nemesis.

Hojlund has shown he can score in the English top flight, with his ten in 30 appearances during the Dane's debut campaign being evidence of that. But with all those struggling around him, the 22-year-old wilted as United plummeted.

The rhetoric surrounding the club this summer has been the need to sign a centre-forward. Hojlund has been linked to the exit door to make that happen despite insisting that he expects to stay at United this summer.

Whether he leaves or not, a new centre-forward is certainly needed. Joshua Zirkzee clearly plays better in the No.10 role and even if Amorim is going to persevere with him as a striker, at least one new centre-forward is needed to provide decent cover to the team.

On Friday, there are just 37 days remaining before the start of the Premier League season. Before then, United will face four Premier League opponents and Fiorentina to prepare for that opening day against Arsenal.
During this timeline, Hojlund will need to prove to Amorim that he can be trusted to be the main striker. If he can do that, the Portuguese could save himself £60m or more in transfer fees.
Strikers at the top of their games this summer have all been valued around this mark. Ollie Watkins, Victor Osimhen and Viktor Gyokeres could all improve United but will cost a king's ransom.

However, if Hojlund proves himself to be capable of being a main striker who can reliably score, a move for a free agent could be seen as viable for Amorim. Signing a player like Callum Wilson or Jamie Vardy could be ideal for United and provide the Dane with a valuable partner to learn from.
But these are all big ifs at the moment. Based on last season, Amorim will feel as though he needs to spend big to strengthen his attack.
Only Hojlund can change his mind.

headline: Man United receive key Marcus Rashford transfer exit 'approval' as £44.8m enquiry made
body: Manchester United are facing the possibility of being left red-faced with their transfer business this summer as their ongoing pursuit of Bryan Mbeumo continues to rumble on.

United's interest in the Brentford star was made public at the start of last month and after receiving the green light from the player, a deal looked set to be completed. However, with Ruben Amorim and his players back in pre-season training, Mbeumo is still a Brentford player.

Two bids have been rejected by the Bees, who are holding firm on their stance of receiving around £65million. The move has meant just Matheus Cunha has arrived at Old Trafford despite the Reds' worst season in 51 years.
Saudi Pro League side Al-Hilal have reportedly inquired about Fiorentina striker and Manchester United transfer target Moise Kean.
According to Matte Moretto, contacts are ongoing between the two teams. Al-Hilal missed out on Victor Osimhen earlier in the window and are searching for a big-name striker this summer.
They have turned their attention to Kean, who has a £44.8m release clause that expires on July 15.

MEN Sport says: "Kean isn't a striker that many United would have expected to be linked with when the transfer window opened earlier this summer. But the slow progress on other targets means an alternative may be signed.

"His release clause presents a decent deal to be had for the Reds. His goal record last season for Fiorentina is exactly what Amorim needs next season. However, many teams have missed out on targets due to the money put on the table by Saudi Arabia and Kean could be the latest example."
Barcelona boss Hansi Flick has reportedly given his green light for the Spanish giants to sign Marcus Rashford from Man United this summer.

Matteo Moretto has explained how new contacts between the two clubs are expected in the coming days with the forward still prioritising the move. It's said that Barcelona will keep the option open and one that could 'become increasingly concrete'.
MEN Sport says: "This is good news for United and Rashford. Barca wanting Rashford is great but the deal not being close to completion means it leaves that unwanted uncertainty.
"Rashford isn't going to be involved in United's squad throughout the summer so his exit is all but certain. Failure to get him out of the door sooner rather than later is a must."

headline: Viktor Gyokeres to Man United transfer latest - fresh hope offered amid Arsenal update
body: Viktor Gyokeres is yet to resolve his future amid ongoing negotiations between Arsenal and Sporting Clube de Portugal over the striker.
However, Manchester United could emerge as a potential alternative, offering him a transfer lifeline.

Recent reports suggest that talks between Arsenal and the Portuguese club have been challenging, with President Frederico Varandas reportedly standing firm on his €70million (£60million) valuation of the Swedish forward.

The gap between Gyokeres' valuation and Arsenal’s offer is reportedly around €5million (£4m). According to The Mirror, who have cited reports from Portugal, Arsenal are prepared to walk away from negotiations with the striker and his representatives, fearing the deal may fall through.
However, a new update could offer a glimmer of hope for the United hierarchy.
Here, MEN Sport has taken a look at the latest news surrounding Gyokeres.

Portuguese newspaper O Jogo has cited Ben Jacobs, who claimed that the door at United has 'never closed' for the Sweden international - even though reports have made clear his apparent desire to join Arsenal.
Although he may be reluctant to move to Old Trafford due to the lack of European football, reports suggest his representatives are aware that a deal could still be salvaged through the Reds.
While president Varandas has remained firm in resisting Arsenal's advances, United have a potential advantage in the form of Ruben Amorim.
The Portuguese coach is considered a key figure in facilitating the move and his strong relationship with Varandas and Sporting will likely to play a significant role.
The No. 9 has openly expressed his admiration for the Reds’ head coach, stemming from their time together at Sporting.
"We won two championships in a row, for the first time in 71 years. It's an incredible achievement, and of course, Ruben Amorim played a big role in that," the striker told France Football.
"I can't thank him enough. The style of play we had under his orders suited me perfectly."

Gyokeres is expected to report for pre-season training on Friday, July 11, after being granted a few extra days by the club. However, reports from Portugal suggest that the 26-year-old does not intend to return, as he continues to push for a move away.

On Thursday, A Bola reported: "Sporting are no longer waiting for the goalscorer to return, and only a last-minute U-turn could make the Swede change his mind and go to the training camp in the Algarve.
The Sun reports that Gyokeres is open to a 'worst-case scenario' loan move for the upcoming season. Juventus and Jose Mourinho's Fenerbahce are reportedly keeping tabs on the striker's situation.

headline: Man United make Alejandro Garnacho pre-season 'decision' as cryptic message sent
body: Manchester United are reportedly willing to allow Alejandro Garnacho to train with his first-team teammates when the winger returns to Carrington this summer.

MEN Sport reported earlier this summer that Ruben Amorim informed the Argentine that he could look for a new club in the upcoming transfer window. This decision was made after Garnacho was vocal about his lack of playing time in the Europa League final.

Napoli and Chelsea have both been heavily linked with a move for Garnacho this summer but no official transfer approach has been forthcoming so far. On Monday, many of the United first-team returned to Carrington for the start of pre-season.

Their breaks are expected to end at some point in July, most likely before the pre-season tour of the United States. ESPN now reports that once Garnacho does return to Carrington, he will not be blocked from training with his teammates.
Notably, Jadon Sancho was banished from the first-team following his fallout with Erik ten Hag in 2023. However, this does not seem to be the case for Garnacho.
This report comes after Garnacho sent a cryptic message to social media on Thursday morning. Posting a picture of himself asleep on a private jet, the winger captioned the photo: "Coming."

It is unclear whether this was referencing himself arriving at a new club or that he was returning to Manchester for the start of pre-season. Either way, the saga surrounding Garnacho's future shows no signs of ending.
